page.title: 11T.RUSHTON HOUSES(PART 2)
page.content: PRIOR TO 1680 WALLS BUILT OF STONE ALONE. OCCASIONAL LINES OF BRICKS HELPED KEEP WALLS PERPENDICULAR. ROOFS SLATE,LESS VULNERABLE TO FIRE. CHALK MIXTURE USED TO BIND STONE WALLS. IF WALLS DAMAGED DETERIORATION IS RAPID. OLD PEOPLES FLATS - 25 YRS. AGO 2 BLOCKS OF 4 FLATS BUILT BY DORSET COUNTY COUNCIL. THESE REPLACED DERELICT COTTAGES. . {BRICK COTTAGES}- 1 PAIR BUILT ABOUT 124 YRS AGO.MODERN RECTORY BUILT 1954. SPECIAL HOUSES - SCHOOL-HOUSE - BUILT ABOUT 124 YRS AGO. A SMALL SCHOOL ADJOINING TEACHER'S HOUSE. NOW CONVERTED INTO ONE DWELLING. TARRANT RUSHTON HOUSE - ORIGINALLY THE RECTORY, NOW IN PRIVATE HANDS. MAIN HOUSE BUILT 1680, STONE & BRICK, ROOF SLATE ( ORIGINALLY THATCH). RT. WING ADDED LATER IN SAME STYLE. L. WING ABOUT 1820 IN STYLE OF TIME.
